Body:
Dear Cecil,
I hope this email finds you well.
Thank you for your note and for considering Zycus as part of RTX’s assessment. I am a point of contact for Business Development in the US, and I have copied my regional sales director, @Richard Hunsinger<mailto:richard.hunsinger@zycus.com>, for further discussion.
I understand your interest lies in evaluating our capabilities around AI-driven spend classification, supplier categorization logic, and advanced algorithms. These are areas where we have been working closely with several global enterprises, and I would be glad to explore how our approach may align with RTX’s priorities.
To move forward, may I suggest a 30-minute call tomorrow at either 9:00 AM or 12:00 PM ET (UTC-5)?
Let me know what time works best, and I’ll coordinate with the appropriate specialists on our side.
Looking forward to your reply.

Best Regards,
Gongiti Rahul Naraian

Subject: Conf Call
RTX X Zycus : Introductory Call
Description:
-- Avoma Note Start --
 Avoma - : RTX X Zycus : Introductory Call <> September 08, 2025 at 2:00 PM UTC
 Avoma Meeting: https://app.avoma.com/meetings/4b86cfc9-c7f5-416f-83a9-917845a226d0/notes
## Participants

  * Zycus: Gongiti Naraian, Marc Quessenberry, Ronit Wadhwa, Iranna Kongali

  * Rtx: Robichon, Cecil (FRA)

## Key Takeaways

  * Frustration was highlighted with the current spend analytics solution, which relies on manual reclassification and unsatisfactory AI logic.
  * Emphasis was placed on the need for a robust, AI-driven spend analytics tool that supports a harmonized taxonomy based on UNSPSC, reflecting their recent internal realignment.
  * Cybersecurity and data integrity concerns were raised, requiring compliance with IT security standards such as Fedramp, ISO 27001, and periodic audit reports.
  * Securing strong references from the aerospace and defense sectors, including established names like Lockheed Martin, was identified as a critical evaluation criterion.
  * Next steps involve sending detailed spend analytics materials, followed by arranging a demo after internal review by the VP and process tools team.

## Action Items

  * Ronit Wadhwa

    * Share an IT security datasheet along with spend analysis offering documents that detail AI capabilities and cybersecurity credentials post-call.
  * Marc Quessenberry

    * Follow up with Cecil Robichon regarding the spend analytics materials and confirm if the initiative is being led by the VP.
    * Compile and send spend analysis materials focused on spend analytics capabilities to RTX and follow up next week.
  * Robichon, Cecil (FRA)

    * Let they know if Robichon, need anything else. and Robichon, look forward again to receive the materials and let they know if Robichon, need anything else

## Aerospace and Defense Sector Specifics

  * Company transformation details were provided, noting RTX’s merger history, current status as the largest aerospace and defense company with $80B in annual revenue, and organic growth of 10% YoY.
  * Emphasis on the critical need for partner solutions to have proven experience and strong references in both aerospace and defense sectors.
  * References to key industry players such as Lockheed Martin, Boeing, and Tata Advanced Systems were mentioned as benchmarks for required credibility in the defense sector.

## Procurement Process Efficiency and Organizational Transformation

  * Initiative led by a VP for non-product procurement, driven by reassessment of spend analytics capabilities to align with new operational and strategic priorities post-merger.
  * Focus on ensuring new tools add value by decreasing manual workload and improving data accuracy, which aligns with RTX’s broader goals of enhanced process efficiency.
  * Pain point highlighted by lengthy manual reclassification processes that detract from strategic procurement activities like renegotiation and contracting.

## Spend Analytics Reassessment

  * Past implementation at GE is highlighted as a positive reference for applying enhanced AI-driven classification.
  * RTX is reassessing spend analytics due to inefficiencies with the current Accenture-developed tool that requires extensive manual reclassification, delaying clean spend data until April/May.

## Spend Analytics Challenges and Needs

  * Desire to reduce manual data reclassification and achieve near 97-100% accuracy through automated classification, addressing the pain point of inefficient spend management.
  * Interest in a solution that streamlines spend analytics focused on precise, automated classification and offers a dedicated, focused approach to spend analytics.
  * Current spend analytics tool, developed by Accenture, requires extensive manual classification causing significant delays, sometimes extending to May each year.

## Taxonomy Harmonization and Classification Requirements

  * Expectation that the solution can support custom taxonomies or hybrid models that blend corporate taxonomies with industry standards for global consistency.
  * Emphasis on consistent categorization across business units to eliminate past discrepancies where different divisions used different taxonomies.
  * The existing taxonomy splits non-product spending into distinct categories such as supply chain and Employee Services, harmonized globally using UNSPSC codes.

## Cybersecurity and Data Privacy Requirements

  * Demand for detailed IT security documentation including ISO 27001, SOC 1, SOC 2 certifications and annual audit reports to satisfy internal compliance teams.
  * Need assurance of data residing in secure US or European (GDPR compliant) data centers, as dictated by defense sector standards.
  * Requirement for strong cybersecurity measures including FedRAMP certification, especially given the sensitive nature of aerospace and defense data.

## Cybersecurity Concerns

  * RTX requires robust cybersecurity; Zycus offers data hosted in US (with EU option), ISO 27001 certification, and SOC 1 and SOC 2 compliance with annual audits.
  * FedRAMP certification is under consideration to meet the needs for managing sensitive aerospace and defense data.

## Industry References

  * Zycus has aerospace/defense references including Lockheed Martin and is in active engagement with Boeing for similar services.
  * Additional reference includes Tata Advanced Systems Limited, a defense manufacturer using Zycus’s capabilities.

 
-- Avoma Note End --
